abstract.text: A text field optimized for performing text-based searches.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: provides a customized text field for entering search data. The class also provides a search button, a cancel button, and a pop-up icon menu for listing recent search strings and custom search categories.
object. The cell provides access to most search field attributes and a comprehensive programmatic interface for manipulating the search field. You can use an
object to manipulate some aspects of the search field.
For additional information about search fields and how to implement them, see the

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your macOS app.
A role-based protocol that declares the minimum interface necessary to interact with an assistive app.
A role-based protocol that declares the minimum interface necessary for an accessibility element to act as navigable static text.
The complete list of properties and methods for accessible elements.
A role-based protocol that declares the minimum interface necessary for an accessibility element to act as static text.
A set of methods that defines a way to add animation to an existing class with a minimum of API impact.
A set of methods for getting and setting the appearance attributes of a view.
A set of methods that the destination object (or recipient) of a dragged image must implement.
A text field optimized for performing text-based searches.
The string that stores the name under which a search field automatically archives a list of recent search strings.
The rectangle for the cancel button within the bounds of the search field.
A Boolean value that determines whether the search field’s components are centered within the control.
The menu item for clearing the current set of recent string searches in the menu.
The delegate for the search field, or
if the search field doesn’t have a delegate.
The maximum number of search strings that can appear in the search menu.
The menu item that describes a lack of recent search strings.
The list of recent search strings for the control.
The name under which the search field automatically archives the list of recent search strings.
The location of recent search strings in the “recents” menu group.
The menu item that provides the title of the menu group for recent search strings.
The rectangle for the cancel button within the bounds of the search field.
The rectangle for the search button within the bounds of the search field.
The rectangle for the search text within the bounds of the field.
The rectangle for the search button within the bounds of the search field.
The menu object used to dynamically construct the search field’s pop-up icon menu.
The rectangle for the search text within the bounds of the search field.
A Boolean value indicating whether the cell calls its action method immediately when an appropriate action occurs.
A Boolean value indicating whether the cell calls its search action method when the user clicks the search button or presses Return, or after each keystroke.
The programmatic interface for text fields that are used for text-based searches.
A protocol that a search field delegate can use to determine when a search started or ended.
Methods that responder subclasses implement to support key binding commands, such as inserting tabs and newlines, or moving the insertion point.
A protocol that describes specific kinds of input content types.
Text the user can select or edit to send an action message to a target when the user presses the Return key.
A protocol that an object adopts to create a bar object in your app.
A protocol that marks classes to restore the state of your app to continue a user activity.
A set of methods used to associate a unique identifier with objects in your user interface.
A protocol that a custom class can adopt to manage the enabled state of a UI element.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
